title: [Caffe2] undefined symbol: GOMP_critical_name_end
body_html:
Issue description

I just installed Caffe2 from source using the following command:

python setup.py build develop --user

I'm trying to import the ONNX backend in Python with

import caffe2.python.onnx.backend

But I get the following critical error:

CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: pytorch/caffe2/python/caffe2_pybind11_state.so: undefined symbol: GOMP_critical_name_end

Python's interactive shell is killed after I write the import statement and get the aforementioned error.

Is there anything I need to customize during Caffe2 installation?

System Info

PyTorch version: 0.5.0a0+d154d32
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0.176

OS: Debian GNU/Linux 8.10 (jessie)
GCC version: (Debian 4.9.2-10+deb8u1) 4.9.2
CMake version: version 3.11.1

Python version: 2.7
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 9.0.176
GPU models and configuration:
GPU 0:
GPU 1:

Nvidia driver version: 390.12
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/local/cuda-7.5/lib64/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-7.5/lib64/libcudnn.so.5
/usr/local/cuda-7.5/lib64/libcudnn.so.5.1.3
/usr/local/cuda-7.5/lib64/libcudnn_static.a
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.7
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.7.0.5
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
[pip] numpy (1.14.1)
[pip] torch (0.5.0a0+d154d32, pytorch)
[pip] torchvision (0.2.0)
[conda] Could not collect

body:
## Issue description

I just installed Caffe2 from source using the following command:

`python setup.py build develop --user`

 I'm trying to import the ONNX backend in Python with

`import caffe2.python.onnx.backend`

But I get the following critical error:

CRITICAL:root:Cannot load caffe2.python. Error: pytorch/caffe2/python/caffe2_pybind11_state.so: undefined symbol: GOMP_critical_name_end

Python's interactive shell is killed after I write the `import` statement and get the aforementioned error.

Is there anything I need to customize during Caffe2 installation?


## System Info
PyTorch version: 0.5.0a0+d154d32
Is debug build: No
CUDA used to build PyTorch: 9.0.176

OS: Debian GNU/Linux 8.10 (jessie)
GCC version: (Debian 4.9.2-10+deb8u1) 4.9.2
CMake version: version 3.11.1

Python version: 2.7
Is CUDA available: Yes
CUDA runtime version: 9.0.176
GPU models and configuration:
GPU 0: 
GPU 1: 

Nvidia driver version: 390.12
cuDNN version: Probably one of the following:
/usr/local/cuda-7.5/lib64/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-7.5/lib64/libcudnn.so.5
/usr/local/cuda-7.5/lib64/libcudnn.so.5.1.3
/usr/local/cuda-7.5/lib64/libcudnn_static.a
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudnn.so
/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudnn.so.7

/usr/local/cuda-9.0/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

Versions of relevant libraries:
